questions.question_text: Test yourself — without looking at the text above, can you name the three tiers of the Panchayati Raj system? What are the key functions of each of the three tiers?
hints: Refer to Fig. 11.1 showing the three-tier structure
Think from village level to district level
Consider functions like local issue resolution, development planning, and coordination

questions.question_text: Write a letter to the Sarpanch regarding the issue of plastic bags lying on the roadside in the village.
hints: Use formal letter format
Clearly describe the problem and its impact
Suggest possible solutions like awareness campaigns or cleanup drives
Mention health and environmental concerns

questions.question_text: In your view, what type of person should be a Gram Panchayat member?
hints: Consider qualities like honesty, commitment to public service
Think about understanding of local issues
Importance of being approachable and inclusive
Ability to work collaboratively

questions.question_text: Let us suppose that you study in a village school. The school is located next to a highway and students find it difficult to cross the road when they come to school or leave at the end of the day. What are the options to solve this issue? Which institutions in the Panchayati Raj can help you? What can the students do?
hints: Identify possible solutions: speed breakers, pedestrian crossing, traffic police
Gram Panchayat can raise the issue, Panchayat Samiti can coordinate
Students can form a safety committee, create awareness
Involve parents and teachers

questions.question_text: How do you think can these old maps be helpful for us? Can they tell us something about the past and the present?
hints: Consider historical land use patterns
Look at changes in village boundaries over time
Understand traditional water sources and pathways
Compare with current satellite imagery

questions.question_text: Why do you think it is important for the government to pay more attention to the needs and problems of the disadvantaged sections of society?
hints: Think about social justice and equality
Consider inclusive development
Mention constitutional values
Discuss empowerment and participation

questions.question_text: As a class activity, let four or five students form a Bal Panchayat and the rest of the class imagine they are the villagers. What issues will the Gram Sabha discuss? What challenges could it encounter? What solutions will it propose?
hints: Consider child-related issues: education, safety, play areas
Possible challenges: limited resources, conflicting opinions
Solutions: community participation, fundraising, awareness programs
Role-play different perspectives

questions.question_text: What similarities and differences do you notice between the governance system at the Central level and at the Panchayat level? (Hint: refer back to Chapter 10 if required.)
hints: Compare election processes
Look at structure: three-tier vs. parliamentary
Consider functions: local vs. national issues
Examine representation: reserved seats, women's participation

questions.question_text: If you get an opportunity to meet a few Panchayat members, what questions would you like to ask them? Discuss in small groups to create a questionnaire. Meet some Gram Panchayat members or invite them to your school. Ask them the questions in your questionnaire and write a short report.
hints: Prepare questions about their daily work
Ask about challenges they face
Inquire about successful projects
Learn about community participation
Document the interview systematically
